body:
Makes sense: The `MoveWhitelistExcludesToCoverage` Migration does not expect there to be more than one `<exclude>` node.

Is that valid? If so, I'd have to update the Migration to deal with it. If not, the XSD should complain about it.

Similarly Drupal uses this filter config, which fails to migrate:

```
  <filter>
    <whitelist>
      <directory>./includes</directory>
      <directory>./lib</directory>
      <!-- Extensions can have their own test directories, so exclude those. -->
      <directory>./modules</directory>
      <exclude>
        <directory>./modules/*/src/Tests</directory>
        <directory>./modules/*/tests</directory>
      </exclude>
      <directory>../modules</directory>
      <exclude>
        <directory>../modules/*/src/Tests</directory>
        <directory>../modules/*/tests</directory>
        <directory>../modules/*/*/src/Tests</directory>
        <directory>../modules/*/*/tests</directory>
      </exclude>
      <directory>../sites</directory>
     </whitelist>
  </filter>
```

It might also be useful if "Migration failed" included the exception message as this can give a hint as to what went wrong.

Same reason though: there are multiple `<exclude>` nodes in the `<whitelist>` container. The Migration code does not support that.

Question remains for @sebastianbergmann: __Is that valid?__

> Is that valid?

Apparently it is supported, although I would consider this to be "unintentionally supported".

At least the XPATH used in the [XMLoader](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/8c908255db023c3861a8f3adc2cad1ed61dc4690/src/TextUI/XmlConfiguration/Loader.php#L659) (silently) supports that. So that means the migration code should support it as well.

Do we want to keep this or should the Migrator merge the contents of the `<exclude>` nodes?

> Do we want to keep this or should the Migrator merge the contents of the `<exclude>` nodes?

We should merge into a single `<exclude>` node.

issue.title: Enhance Exclude Migration to support multiple occurrences
issue.body:
Closes #4419

This also introduces a SnapshotNodeList helper since we can't use live
lists as we are modifying the DOM tree while iterating

issue.title: chore: phpunit migrate configuration

labels.name: samples
labels.description: Issues that are directly related to samples.

repository.name: php-docs-samples
repository.description: A collection of samples that demonstrate how to call Google Cloud services from PHP.

issue.body:
PhpUnit throws the following error / suggestion, hence upgrading all it's configs by using `--migrate-configuration`:
```
Warning:       Your XML configuration validates against a deprecated schema.
Suggestion:    Migrate your XML configuration using "--migrate-configuration"!
```

Here's the script to do this migration:

Command to migrate PhpUnit configs:
```
php-docs-samples > find * -name 'phpunit.xml*' -not -path '*vendor/*' | \
xargs -I {} bash -c "echo \"## Running for '{}'\" && testing/vendor/bin/phpunit  -c {} --migrate-configuration && git add {}"
```

## Logs: 
1. Migration fails for certain phpunit config files which have multiple entries in `exclude`  tag:
https://paste.googleplex.com/5904304555687936

2. Migration successfully completed for all phpunit config files:
https://paste.googleplex.com/5638483191267328
